title: 'Lot Of Space Before Nuclear Threshold Is Crossed': Top Military Official On Op Sindoor
content: India switched tactics after suffering losses in the air on the first day of conflict with Pakistan earlier this month and established a decisive advantage before the neighbours announced a ceasefire three days later.

title: "Operation Shield": Civil Defence Exercise Conducted In Punjab, Haryana
content: The authorities in Punjab and Haryana on Saturday conducted a major statewide civil defence exercise named "Operation Shield" to enhance emergency preparedness and response capabilities.

title: Exposure To Wildfire Smoke May Shorten Survival Of Lung Cancer Patients
content: Exposure to wildfire smoke may increase lung cancer patients' risk of dying from their disease, particularly among non-smokers, but the effect may be mitigated by certain cancer treatments, according to a study.

title: Centre Cracks Down On Unauthorised Walkie-Talkie Sales. Here's Why
content: Amid heightened security concerns after the Pahalgam terror attack, the Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has released detailed guidelines and issued notices to prevent the unauthorised sale of radio equipment, including walkie-talkies.

title: 7 Killed In Landslides In Arunachal Pradesh
content: Seven people, including two women and two children, were killed in a massive landslide on National Highway-13 in Arunachal Pradesh's East Kameng district amid heavy rains, officials said here on Saturday.

title: Steam Engines That Run Darjeeling's Iconic Toy Train Turn 125
content: The steam engine-powered narrow-gauge railway known as the toy train or Darjeeling Himalayan Railway (DHR), a train service from the New Jalpaiguri railhead near Siliguri to the hill station of Darjeeling, has achieved a major milestone.

title: Mukhtar Ansari's MLA Son Abbas Sentenced To 2-Year Jail In Hate Speech Case
content: Uttar Pradesh MLA Abbas Ansari, son of gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari, was sentenced to two years imprisonment in a 2022 hate speech case by a special MP-MLA court on Saturday.

title: Cops Say Influencer's Arrest Over Communal Post Lawful, BJP Slams Trinamool
content: Dimissing claims that an Instagram influencer, who uploaded a video with alleged communal comments in reference to Operation Sindoor was arrested unlawfully, the Kolkata Police has said several attempts were made to serve notice to her.

title: Iran Has Increased Production Of Near Weapons-Grade Uranium: UN Watchdog
content: As of May 17, the country amassed 408.6 kilograms of uranium enriched up to 60%, marking an increase of 133.8 kilograms since the agency's last report in February.

title: Analysis: India's Big Political Families And Their Bitter Feuds
content: Every regional political party in India, barring one or two notable exceptions like the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) in Tamil Nadu, are a family enterprise. Succession battles put father against son, brother against brother.

title: Analysis: 5 Reasons Why Congress Has No Shield For Shashi Tharoor Missile
content: Call him the diplomat who knows how to flex his political muscle, or call him the politician who can take a diplomatic stand not in line with his own party, Congress's four-time Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor has been an uncomfortable reality.

title: Nirmala Sitharaman Responds To LinkedIn User's "Corruption In GST Registrations" Claim
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has responded to a social media post that claimed fraudulent activities in the GST registration process.

title: Chandrababu Naidu On Key Difference Between BJP, Opposition Leadership
content: The key difference between the BJP today and the opposition is leadership, said veteran politician and Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, Chandrababu Naidu.

title: "Space Future Begins Now": ISRO Chief On Indian Astronaut's Spaceflight
content: India's Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is set to travel to space aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon as part of a crew that will include Slawosz Uznanski-Wisniewski from Poland and Tibor Kapu of Hungary for the June 8 Axiom Mission 4.

title: "Government With Double Face": MJ Akbar On Why Talks With Pak Are A "Bluff"
content: The Centre has formed many delegations as a part of its diplomatic outreach program after Operation Sindoor - a targeted military strike on terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK).

title: Colombia's U-Turn On Pak Deaths, Day After Shashi Tharoor's "Disappointment"
content: Colombia will issue a statement of strong support for India's position after the country withdrew their statement condoling the deaths in Pakistan following Operation Sindoor.

title: 6,000 People, 4 Bunkers: NDTV Ground Report From J&K's Poonch
content: Despite the central government having allocated over Rs 400 crore in recent years for the construction of bunkers to safeguard border residents, many villagers say the promised shelters remain either incomplete or missing.

title: Exclusive: Chandrababu Naidu Says "Good Friend" Bill Gates Initially Refused To Meet Him
content: In an exclusive NDTV interview, N Chandrababu Naidu discussed how he established his friendship with Bill Gates after a meeting in Delhi.

title: Nara Lokesh As TDP Working President? Father Chandrababu Naidu Says...
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu has finally reacted to reports of his son Nara Lokesh's possible promotion as the working president of the Telugu Desam Party.

title: 5 Killed, 6 Injured As Car Carrying Wedding Guests Overturns In UP
content: Five people, including a child, lost their lives and six others were seriously injured when a car carrying wedding guests overturned and fell into a ditch in the Majhila police station area of Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi district.

title: 'Near-combat conditions': Army launches massive exercise across India to test defence systems
content: The demonstrations are part of the Indian Army’s larger roadmap for a “Decade of Transformation” and aim to fast-track the absorption of emerging technologies, particularly those developed under the Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative. A wide range of platforms is undergoing trials, showcasing the synergy between the Indian Army and indigenous defence manufacturers.

title: After warning on China, US bats for stronger military ties with India
content: US Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth, at the Shangri-La Dialogue, emphasized deepening security ties with India and advocated for expanded QUAD cooperation to counter China's assertiveness. He highlighted initiatives like the Indo-Pacific Logistics Network and the Partnership for Indo-Pacific Industrial Resilience (PIPER) to bolster regional defence capabilities and supply chains.

title: 'Fog of war lifting': Kharge attacks Modi govt after remarks by CDS on Op Sindoor
content: Mallikarjun Kharge, the Congress president, criticized the Modi government. This followed CDS General Anil Chauhan's statements in Singapore. Kharge demanded a special Parliament session. He alleged the nation was misled. Chauhan dismissed Pakistan's claims about downed Indian warplanes. He spoke about Operation Sindoor. Jairam Ramesh echoed Kharge's concerns. He criticized the government's lack of transparency regarding the matter.

title: Influencer sent to 13-day custody; BJP accuses TMC of 'appeasement politics'
content: Sharmishtha Panoli, an Instagram influencer, has been remanded to judicial custody until June 13 after being arrested by Kolkata Police for allegedly making communal remarks in a social media video criticizing Bollywood's silence on Operation Sindoor. BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari has criticized the arrest as appeasement politics, alleging selective action against Sanatanis while ignoring similar offenses by TMC leaders.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to staff in Town Hall: 6000 job cuts were related to…
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella attributed recent layoffs to reorganization rather than performance, impacting even product development roles. The company is aggressively pushing its Copilot AI assistants, securing a significant deal with Barclays for 100,000 licenses. While adoption is growing, some clients are proceeding cautiously, awaiting clearer returns on Microsoft's AI investments.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has an open challenge for OpenAI, Perplexity CEO
content: Sundar Pichai, Google CEO, addressed concerns from news publishers about the impact of AI Overviews on their traffic. He defended Google's approach and highlighted the company's commitment to directing users to the web. Pichai challenged rival companies like Perplexity and OpenAI, asserting Google prioritizes sending traffic to websites more than others. He also acknowledged competition from ChatGPT.

title: Will rain play spoilsport in PBKS vs MI Qualifier 2 in Ahmedabad?
content: Mumbai Indians will take on Punjab Kings in Qualifier 2 of IPL 2025 for a spot in the final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. The game set to commence on June 1 is under threat from the possibility of rain, with Ahmedabad experiencing light showers a day ahead of the high-octane clash.

title: 'Condition so bad ...': Kishore's jab at Nitish after Bihar CM's latest gaffe
content: Jan Suraaj chief Prashant Kishore has intensified his criticism of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar after Kumar's recent gaffe of mixing PM Modi's name with Atal Bihari Vajpayee. Kishore accused BJP of imposing Kumar on Bihar's youth, citing concerns over his mental and physical health.

title: 10 magical ways to relax after work that actually make a difference
content: Feeling drained after work? The article suggests simple yet effective ways to unwind and rejuvenate. Practices like deep breathing, grounding exercises, and gentle neck rolls can release tension. Mindful water rituals and child's pose moments offer rest. Ending the day with gratitude, a digital sunset, gentle twists, aromatherapy, and setting intentions for tomorrow promotes overall well-being, honoring the body's needs.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after it laid off over 2k software engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: ‘Nothing but love’: Shubman Gill shuts down rumours of rift with Hardik Pandya
content: Gujarat Titans captain Shubman Gill has quashed rumours of a rift with Mumbai Indians' Hardik Pandya after a video from the IPL 2025 Eliminator went viral. Gill posted a photo on Instagram, smiling alongside Pandya, stating, "Nothing but love," dismissing online speculation.

title: What FM Sitharaman said on claims of GST registration corruption, delay
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman lauded the CBIC for its swift response to social media allegations of GST registration delays and corruption. A Twitter user shared claims of a 20-day wait, prompting CBIC to clarify that the application was under Delhi State GST jurisdiction and awaiting taxpayer clarification on a rent agreement detail. Sitharaman emphasized transparency and integrity in taxpayer service.

title: Maple Leafs prospect Cowan leads London Knights to 2025 Memorial Cup final rematch
content: Toronto Maple Leafs prospect Easton Cowan leads the London Knights back to the 2025 Memorial Cup Final, aiming for redemption after last year’s loss. With an impressive postseason performance and a dominant team record, Cowan is key to the Knights’ championship hopes. They face the undefeated Medicine Hat Tigers in a highly anticipated rematch for Memorial Cup glory.

title: 'Get ready for another 9/11': Trump ally Loomer attacks Mira Nair's son
content: Laura Loomer ignited controversy by targeting New York mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani, linking him to 9/11 due to his Muslim faith and socialist views. Mamdani, a progressive gaining traction with young and immigrant voters, faces criticism for his stance on Indian Prime Minister Modi. Despite backlash, his campaign resonates with Muslim voters, potentially influencing the upcoming Democratic primary.

title: Bumrah, Tewatia engage in heated exchange during IPL 2025 Eliminator
content: During a high-pressure IPL 2025 Eliminator, Jasprit Bumrah and Rahul Tewatia were involved in a heated exchange. The incident occurred after Tewatia hit Bumrah for a six, followed by two missed shots. Bumrah took offense to Tewatia's mutterings, leading to a brief but intense confrontation, highlighting the emotions of knockout cricket.

title: Stewart’s future in question as father blasts Bengals over unfair contract clause
content: First overall pick Shemar Stewart's NFL debut with the Cincinnati Bengals is jeopardized due to a contract dispute. Stewart's father, Moe Marquez, alleges the Bengals are attempting to insert a clause allowing the team to cancel guaranteed money if Stewart violates certain rules, a term absent in previous rookie contracts.

title: Mumbai University UG admission 2025: MU second merit list released
content: Mumbai University released the second merit list for UG admissions 2025-26 on May 31, 2025, with K.P.B Hinduja College of Commerce showing increased cut-offs, especially FYBAF at 87.33%. The science stream for FYBAMMC also saw a notable rise. Candidates must complete verification and fee payment by June 4. More college lists are expected soon, with the third merit list scheduled for June 5. Classes begin June 13, 2025.

title: 2-year imprisonment for Mukhtar's son Abbas Ansari in 'hisab-kitab’ episode
content: Annas Ansari, son of the late Mukhtar Ansari, faces legal consequences. A court in Mau sentenced him to two years in jail. The case relates to a 2022 incident. Ansari allegedly made threatening remarks against officials at a public meeting. The court found him guilty under multiple sections of the IPC. This development follows a police investigation and ECI action.

title: Karun Nair slams double century, stakes claim for India playing XI spot
content: Karun Nair showcased his batting prowess by scoring a double century for India A against England Lions in Canterbury, marking his fourth 200+ score in First-Class cricket. The Karnataka batter, who boasts a First-Class best of 328, is hoping to seal a place in the India playing XI for the five-match Test series against England that starts on June 20.

title: BSEB 10th, 12th compartmental result 2025 declared: Check direct link
content: The Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) has declared the Class 10 and 12 compartmental and special exam results 2025 on results.biharboardonline.com. The pass percentage varied, with Class 12 compartment at 61.13% and Class 10 compartment at 32.93%. Students can check their results online using their roll code and number. Science toppers showed significant improvement. Digital marksheets are available for download, while physical copies will be distributed by schools.

title: Influencer Sharmishtha Panoli arrested in Gurgaon for post on Bollywood's silence on Op Sindoor
content: Kolkata Police apprehended Sharmishtha Panoli, an Instagram influencer, from Gurgaon. The arrest relates to a communal video she posted targeting Bollywood actors. The video concerned their silence on Operation Sindoor. Following backlash, Panoli deleted the video and apologized. However, a complaint was already filed in Kolkata. After failed attempts to serve notices, a warrant was issued leading to her arrest.

title: An Indian-origin physician treats Harvard grads to life lessons
content: At Harvard's convocation, Dr. Abraham Verghese, an Indian-origin physician and author, delivered a commencement speech subtly critiquing the MAGA-infused political climate. He highlighted the importance of American values like the rule of law and truth, which he believes are currently under threat.

title: 'Kohli enjoys overseas lads who ...': Bethell jokes about 'too-soft' IPL beds
content: Jacob Bethell, fresh off his IPL stint, starred in England's ODI victory, though he humorously bemoaned the soft hotel beds affecting his back. Despite limited game time with Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Bethell emphasises the invaluable learning experience, particularly observing Virat Kohli's approach to spin and his captivating presence both on and off the field.

title: Op Sindoor biggest, most successful anti-terror op in India's history: PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the BSF's women personnel for their bravery during Operation Sindoor, highlighting their crucial role in the successful counter-terrorism effort. He emphasized India's growing confidence in women's capabilities across various sectors, from defense to science. During the event, he released a commemorative coin for Ahilyabai Holkar and inaugurated development projects in Madhya Pradesh.

title: What are meliponine, burgall? The words that made Indian-Americans lose spelling bee title
content: Faizan Zaki, a 13-year-old from Dallas, Texas, triumphed at the 2025 Scripps National Spelling Bee, securing victory by correctly spelling “Chaldee.” After a near miss in the 18th round, Zaki persevered, overcoming finalists Sarvadnya Kadam and Sarv Dharavane.

title: In homestay mishap, teen girl shoots herself in neck with boyfriend’s gun in Maharashtra
content: In Palghar, a 17-year-old girl accidentally shot herself in the neck with her 18-year-old boyfriend's illegal firearm at a Kelwa homestay. The girl is in critical condition, and police have arrested the boyfriend, charging him with kidnap, attempted murder, and violations of the Arms Act. Authorities are investigating whether the homestay followed proper check-in procedures, given the girl's minor status.

title: NFL stars skip first voluntary day of OTAs as contract and trade talks intensify
content: As NFL OTAs get underway, notable absences like Kirk Cousins, T.J. Watt, and Micah Parsons spark speculation. Cousins' absence fuels trade rumors after being benched, while Watt seeks a market-adjusting contract extension. Parsons' OTA skip aligns with contract talks, and James Cook eyes a top-tier running back salary, highlighting the strategic off-field maneuvers shaping the 2025 season.

title: Caught on cam: 20-year-old drowns in ‘5-6 ft-deep’ pool during wedding
content: A 20-year-old e-rickshaw driver, Ayan Ahmed, tragically drowned in a farmhouse swimming pool during a friend's sister's wedding celebration near Bhopal. Ayan and his friends were cooling off in the pool when he submerged after using the slide. Despite attempts to revive him, he died in the hospital. Police are investigating possible negligence by the farmhouse.

title: Odisha BJP neta among 8 tourists missing after vehicle falls into Sikkim river
content: Odisha BJP Mahila Morcha secretary Itishree Jena and her son are missing after their vehicle plunged into the Teesta river in Sikkim, resulting in one death. Six of Itishree's family members, along with four tourists from Tripura, were in the vehicle. Two boys, including Itishree's younger son, survived and are hospitalized.

title: 'They're going to be ok': Trump on Chinese students after visa crackdown
content: Amidst rising tensions between the Trump administration and academic institutions, particularly Harvard, President Trump offered reassurance to Chinese students in the US, stating they would be "ok." This shift follows a judge's block on Trump's efforts to restrict international student enrollment at Harvard, which he criticized for withholding student lists.

title: World Boxing introduces mandatory sex tests for all fighters
content: World Boxing mandates sex tests for all fighters in sponsored events, ensuring fairness and safety. This decision follows controversy surrounding Algerian boxer Imane Khelif, whose gender was questioned after a match. Khelif must undergo testing to compete in the Eindhoven Box Cup. Athletes will undergo PCR genetic tests, with further evaluations if male chromosomal material is detected.

title: Assam picking up Bangladeshi illegals, dumping them in no-man's land
content: Assam's government is intensifying efforts to deport individuals declared illegal foreigners by tribunals, leading to legal challenges. Recent pushbacks into the India-Bangladesh border have prompted petitions to the Supreme Court and Gauhati HC, seeking the whereabouts of family members.

title: 5 dead in Guwahati landslides amid heavy rain in Assam; schools, colleges shut
content: At least five, including children, died in landslides in Guwahati's Kamrup (Metro) amid relentless monsoon rain. Over 10,000 people in Kamrup, Kamrup (Metro), and Cachar face urban flooding. Red alerts were issued across Assam, with schools shut and special leave granted to government employees as rain continues to batter the state.

title: Delhi HC dismisses Lalu Yadav’s plea seeking stay in land-for-jobs scam case
content: The Delhi High Court has rejected Lalu Prasad Yadav's plea to halt trial court proceedings in the 'land-for-jobs' case. Yadav argued the CBI's investigation was invalid due to the lack of prior sanction under the Prevention of Corruption Act. The CBI countered, stating sanction was secured and Section 17A wasn't applicable, with the issue pending before the Supreme Court.

title: 'Game isn't over until Bumrah's done bowling': De Villiers after MI beat GT
content: Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling performance led Mumbai Indians to a 20-run victory over Gujarat Titans in the IPL 2025 Eliminator. AB de Villiers lauded Bumrah as a game-changer, emphasizing his impact until the very end. Bumrah's crucial dismissal of Washington Sundar shifted the momentum, while Hardik Pandya's strategic use of Bumrah and Sai Sudharsan's dismissal proved pivotal.

title: Non-veg breakfast removed from Chennai Vande Bharat trains
content: Commuters on Chennai's Vande Bharat Express trains are expressing discontent over the sudden unavailability of non-vegetarian breakfast options, despite the absence of any prior notification from Southern Railway or IRCTC. Passengers report encountering misleading information during booking and receiving only vegetarian meals onboard.

title: IPL: Bairstow's Sehwag-like knock neutralises GT's 'trump card' Krishna
content: Jonny Bairstow, after being written off and going unsold in the IPL auction, silenced his critics with a blistering knock in the Eliminator. His aggressive assault on Prasidh Krishna, reminiscent of Sehwag's dominance over Gul, propelled Mumbai Indians to a commanding total.

title: 'Ridiculous Rahul': BJP slams Cong after Salman Khurshid's support for Op Sindoor
content: Following Salman Khurshid's endorsement of the government's handling of Jammu & Kashmir and Pakistan, including the abrogation of Article 370 and Operation Sindoor, the BJP has launched an attack against Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of echoing Pakistani propaganda.

title: 6 dead, 5 injured as car carrying wedding guests overturns in UP's Hardoi
content: A tragic accident in Hardoi claimed six lives and injured five others early Saturday. The incident occurred near Ghazipur village when a car carrying wedding guests overturned, reportedly due to the driver losing control. Among the deceased were two brothers and a young child. Police are investigating the crash, which happened as the vehicle returned to Pali from Kusuma village.

title: Thibs' rotation, Haliburton's comeback? What to watch for in crucial Knicks-Pacers Game 6
content: The Eastern Conference finals head back to Indiana. Here's everything you need to know ahead of Game 6.

title: Ohtani outduels Judge as Dodgers drop Yankees
content: Shohei Ohtani homered twice as the Dodgers overcame an Aaron Judge homer and a three-run deficit to beat the Yankees in the first game of their World Series rematch.

title: Lawsuit accuses Zion of rape, years of abuse
content: A woman has accused Pelicans forward Zion Williamson of rape in addition to "sexual, physical, emotional and financial" abuse during a relationship that lasted from 2018 to 2023, according to a lawsuit submitted to Los Angeles Superior Court.

title: Sinner drops just 3 games to roll into 4th round
content: World No. 1 Jannik Sinner delivered a flawless performance against Jiri Lehecka with a 6-0, 6-1, 6-2 rout in little more than 90 minutes to cruise into the French Open fourth round.

title: Sources: Dodgers' Betts out due to fractured toe
content: Dodgers star Mookie Betts will miss the rest of the series against the Yankees after sources confirmed he has a fractured toe.

title: Trout returns in new spot, has hit in Angels' win
content: Angels slugger Mike Trout was activated off the injured list and went 1-for-5 as the designated hitter in Friday night's 4-1 win over the Guardians.

title: Sources: 49ers finalizing deal for Eagles DE Huff
content: The 49ers and Eagles are working to finalize a trade that will send edge rusher Bryce Huff to San Francisco for a midround pick, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Wings' Bueckers placed into concussion protocol
content: Wings point guard Paige Bueckers will miss at least two games after being placed in the concussion protocol.

title: MMA fighter Davis leads antitrust suit vs. UFC
content: Veteran MMA fighter and former Bellator champion Phil Davis has filed an antitrust lawsuit against the UFC accusing the promotion of a "predatory scheme to undermine would be competitors."

title: 🏈 CFP format debate: What we've learned
content: The debate about the future format of the CFP is raging. Particularly, how it hurts or helps the biggest leagues.

title: 'The greatest to ever do it': How Patty Gasso built a superpower at Oklahoma
content: Former players, coaches on how Oklahoma softball coach Patty Gasso became the sport's greatest coach.

title: PSG vs. Inter Milan: Ultimate UEFA Champions League final preview, predictions
content: PSG vs. Inter Milan has storylines galore, from the battle of MVP goalkeepers to PSG's treble quest and so much more. Here's everything you need to know.

title: How Freddie Freeman's World Series grand slam changed him -- and Dodgers fans -- forever
content: There are bobbleheads, T-shirts, tattoos -- and even one fan, according to Freeman, who said he hadn't touched a drink since.

title: Is Shedeur Sanders set up to win QB battle in Browns' new-look offense?
content: The Browns have a lot of new faces on offense, including at coordinator and under center, as they reshape the unit.

title: Expert picks and best bets: Can Barber extend her win streak vs. Blanchfield?
content: Retired MMA fighters Din Thomas and Anthony Smith make their predictions for the main event of the upcoming UFC Fight Night.

title: Liverpool confirm Frimpong deal after TAA exit
content: Liverpool have signed Jeremie Frimpong from Bayer Leverkusen, the Premier League champions confirmed on Friday.

title: Source: Liverpool bid club-record $147M for Wirtz
content: Liverpool have submitted a club-record €130 million bid to sign Bayer Leverkusen playmaker Florian Wirtz this summer, a source has told ESPN.

title: Mexico confirms co-hosting 2031 WWC with U.S.
content: Mexico confirmed it will co-host the 2031 Women's World Cup with the United States in FIFA's first expanded 48-team tournament.

title: LAFC chases 'massive' $9.5M Club World Cup spot
content: LAFC will host Club América in a high-stakes play-in match on Saturday night for the final spot in the expanded FIFA Club World Cup.

title: Dembélé: Focused on UCL title not Ballon d'Or
content: Paris Saint-Germain forward Ousmane Dembélé has said that a potential Ballon d'Or award is at the back of his mind as he prepares for Saturday's Champions League final.

title: San Diego FC to ban 33 fans over postgame brawl
content: San Diego FC announced 33 individuals will be banned indefinitely from attending all club and MLS matches after a violent clash between supporters following a match against the LA Galaxy.

title: Hayes: Starlet Yohannes has big USWNT future
content: USWNT head coach Emma Hayes sung the praises of 17-year-old midfielder Lily Yohannes again on Friday, saying Yohannes has a bright future with the program.

title: Alexander-Arnold joins Real Madrid, set for CWC
content: Real Madrid have signed Trent Alexander-Arnold, with a source telling ESPN the clubs agreed to a €10m deal for his early release for the Club World Cup.

title: Panthers-Oilers II: Key stats to know for the 2025 Stanley Cup Final
content: For the second consecutive season, it's Florida-Edmonton. Here's what you need to know before Game 1.

title: Something about this OKC team looks familiar — and the NBA should be terrified
content: The Thunder have followed in the footsteps of the 2014-15 Golden State Warriors this season. Is a future dynasty in the making?

title: Updated NBA draft rankings: How the NCAA withdrawal deadline shook up the top 100
content: With 18 of our top 100 NBA prospects returning to college, there's movement in our list, starting at No. 5.

title: NBA draft withdrawal deadline: NIL's impact, Florida's gain, the 2026 draft, more
content: Who are biggest winners and losers from prospects' decisions to stay or go? We answer the burning questions.

title: Where Clark, Bueckers fit in MVP, Rookie of the Year race
content: Just two weeks into the season, the WNBA MVP and Rookie of the Year races have clear frontrunners. Andre Snellings looks at the best bets to make right now.

title: USC trolls Oregon, Dan Lanning's pool jump with 'Anchorman' commitment alert
content: Lanning went viral in early May for jumping in a pool with five-star recruit Richard Wesley after Wesley's commitment to Oregon. Wesley decommitted on May 27.

title: Conference USA preview: Liberty is early favorite but contenders abound
content: The Flames are the team to beat, but Western Kentucky and Jacksonville State (among others) can't be counted out.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs eye move for Spurs' Son
content: Tottenham's Son Heung-Min is linked with a possible move to the Saudi Pro League. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Why the Maple Leafs shouldn't re-sign Mitch Marner -- and what they should do instead
content: Toronto has some franchise-altering decisions to make this summer, starting with the perennial All-Star.

title: F1 25 review -- A familiar package with a shining, compelling story mode
content: the introduction of the Braking Point story mode into the series has been interesting to watch . fans of the series scorned it for using up resources that could've gone into the more traditional modes . it's a trend that EA Sports F1 25 will likely continue .

title: The Travis Hunter two-way experiment will have contract consequences
content: the Jacksonville Jaguars say they have a plan for hybrid rookie superstar Travis Hunter . if Hunter is the player the Jaguars imagine he can be for them, it would raise interesting issues in future years regarding how he gets on both sides of the ball .

title: How NiJaree Canady became college softball's first million-dollar player
content: the 2024 USA Collegiate Softball player of the year is reshaping college softball . she landed the richest softball deal ever . her new home would be on the arid plains of west Texas at a school .

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: McDavid is Conn Smythe fave in Panthers rematch
content: the Edmonton Oilers beat the Florida Panthers 3-0 in the last year's Stanley Cup final . Connor McDavid and the Oilers won the next three to force a Game 7 . the oilers defeated their in-state rivals, the Tampa Bay Lightning in the first round, the Toronto Maple Leafs in a seven-game second round .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Notre Dame pushes closer to the top spot
content: Notre Dame has pushed its way into the no. 2 slot of our 2026 class rankings . the Fighting Illini shook off the loss of ESPN 300 CB Victor Singleton quite well . Nasir Rankin , a top-10 athlete in the ESPN 300, is an early in-state priority .

title: Ranking the 30 players who will decide the UEFA Champions League final
content: Across their 16 matches this season, PSG averaged 60.1% possession -- more than all but Manchester City and Bayern Munich . but possession doesn't equal wins or more attempts on goal . the odds reflect this, too, based on what's currently posted at ESPN BET .

title: EA Sports College Football 26 gameplay officially revealed in new trailer
content: college football 26 will include thousands of real college players and over 300 real-world coaches . the game also has added over 2700 new plays, which EA Sports says will make for "authentic college football like never before" the series started in 1993 with the release of Bill Walsh College Football on the Sega Genesis .

title: Study finds 17.4% prevalence of PCOS in Delhi’s college-going women
content: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, the endocrinologic disorder affecting females in the reproductive age, characterised by menstrual dysfunction, infertility, hirsutism, acne, and obesity, is ‘prevalent yet under-researched’, the study says

title: Karamana’s riverside walkway on path to becoming a full-fledged urban living space
content: 1.45-km walkway is undergoing a more ambitious makeover since March 2024 with the  construction of a cafeteria, toilet complex, football turf and cricket pitches

title: Name slips to promote messages against drug abuse in schools
content: Health Minister says the idea is to make children aware from a very young age that they should stay away from drugs

title: Case of disproportionate assets: VACB squad recovers several suspicious documents
content: The documents were recovered during a flash inspection at the house of retired superintending engineer of Kozhikode Corporation

title: Manipur BJP legislators push for government formation
content: BJP State chief A. Sharda Devi says a new government’s focus should be on peace and development; adds that everything depends on the party’s central leadership

title: SC residents of Thalugai panchayat in Tiruchi district seek recognition for burial ground, cremation facility
content: Residents had been conducting last rites along the banks of the Thalugai water channel, a practice, they say, undermines their dignity and often led to disputes

title: Kavitha intensifies political activity, plans protest on June 4 against notice to KCR over Kaleshwaram fiasco
content: She opens new office of Telangana Jagruthi, demands CM to make his stand clear on AP’s plans to divert Godavari water to Krishna, Penna basins

title: Long-pending airstrip project in Wayanad yet to take  off
content: The demand for a feeder airport in Wayanad started more than a decade ago as it is expected to alleviate travel woes and boost development and tourism in the district

title: Civil defence exercise 'Operation Shield' conducted in Punjab and Haryana
content: Scenes of volunteers enacting as injured being taken on stretchers to ambulances and fire being put out played out during the mock drills

title: Now, essential goods will be supplied through fair price shops in Andhra Pradesh, says Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan
content: The shops will function twice a day for 15 days every month, and the aim is to prevent irregularities and ensure every poor family gets its entitled share of ration, he says

title: Rain havoc: Eight missing fishers found safe, one still missing
content: Two relief camps opened in district. Heavy rainfall accompanied by gusty winds had caused extensive damage to property in the district over the past one week

title: Government is spending ₹33,600 crore to give pensions to 68 lakh people in a year, says Endowments Minister
content: The Minister hails Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu, says he is prioritising the welfare of the people despite the State’s dire financial situation and putting A.P. on the right track

title: Incessant rain batters highways and houses in Tripura
content: Low-lying areas submerged; traffic and power supply disrupted across State as trees fall on electric poles; heavy rain to continue in all eight districts

title: World Milk Day: India’s dairy sector requires support to meet global challenges
content: India’s dairy sector needs a focused support package targeting smallholders, women, and entrepreneurs. Being the world’s largest milk producer, the country is increasingly pushing for sustainable milk production and nutritional security

title: Free agency and draft plans for Stars, Hurricanes, every other eliminated team
content: the 2024-25 NHL regular season is over and the playoffs are underway . a breakdown of the biggest keys this offseason and realistic expectations for next season . more teams will be added to this story as they are eliminated .

title: HC dismisses petition by man who sent message threatening CM
content: Dismissing the petition by a bank employee court says if it were to declare without even a trial that no offence was made, it will send a wrong message to society

title: India showcases cultural renaissance at Osaka World Expo
content: Indian pavilion highlights ancient philosophies and modern aspirations under theme of compassion and inclusivity

title: Congress criticises Centre over Armed Forces remarks at Jabalpur rally
content: Leaders question PM’s handling of Operation Sindoor response, allege political appropriation of military amid U.S. influence

title: As COVID-19 cases rise, Kerala steps up monitoring
content: As on May 31, State has 1,336 active cases of COVID-19. Health officials say the variant LF.7, currently in circulation, causes only mild illness but is highly transmissible. Hence the public should take standard precautions to prevent transmission, they say

title: Elevated road work to be completed before deadline, says MLA
content: MLA of Hubballi Dharwad Central Assembly Constituency Mahesh Tenginakai has said that keeping in mind the interests of the traders and business establishments, the height of the elevated road at Kittur Chennamma Circle had been increased by one metre and accordingly work was being executed.

title: Kolkata Police arrests social media influencer for making communal remarks on Operation Sindoor, Pahalgam attacks
content: Social media handles call arrest unlawful and biased; police clarifies that the arrest was through due process

title: Flood woes continue in central Travancore despite lull in rains
content: Orange alert issued for the Manimala and Achankovil rivers. As many as 39 relief camps opened in Alappuzha, 58 in Kottayam, and  35 relief camps in Pathanamthitta

title: Siddaramaiah directs CS to issue notices to DDPIs for poor show in SSLC results
content: The pass percentage of students in government schools during the 2025 SSLC exam was below 60 in many districts

title: Miss World 2025 grand finale kicks off in Hyderabad with glamour and grandeur
content: The spectacular opening at the Hitex Exhibition Centre, Hyderabad, marked the culmination of a month-long celebration of beauty, talent, and purpose

title: Supriya Sahu honoured for contribution in fight against financial crimes
content: She was one of the few individuals honoured for her exemplary leadership and service at the 41st Plenary Meeting of the Eurasian Group held in November 2024 in Indore

title: Final preparations under way for school reopening in Kottayam
content: District Education department completes inspections of all 910 schools across Kottayam. Adverse weather and the operation of relief camps in a few school premises may delay reopening in a few cases

title: Farmers protest against construction of regulator at Uthamasolapuram in Nagapattinam district
content: Farmers and residents say the construction of the regulator would make it difficult to take up agricultural operations in the region and wanted the structure to be buil at anothe site

title: Metro trains start running in Indore as PM Modi inaugurates first phase
content: Commercial operations started on Saturday (May 31, 2025) on the approximately 6 km ‘Super Priority Corridor’ between Gandhi Nagar Station and Station No 3 of the `Super Corridor’, officials said

title: Tiruchi Corporation to use liquid chlorination for better water quality
content: The spot chlorination system, which exists at 20 places, will be installed for all tanks  in Tiruchi city; under the system an electric motor pump automatically adds chlorinated water at the time of refilling the tank

title: Be wary of those trying to stoke communal tension, cautions Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Recalling the recent attempt of a few to portray the death of a Hyderabad-based pastor in Rajamahendravaram as murder, the Chief Minister appeals to people to maintain calm so that the motive behind such incidents can be established

title: U.P. MLA Abbas Ansari gets two-year jail term in hate speech case
content: Ansari had threatened government officials of consequences if the Samajwadi Party came to power after the 2022 U.P. election

title: Sacrificial sheep become dearer in Tiruchi ahead of Bakrid
content: The average price varies between ₹490 to ₹600 a kg depending on the animal; meat sellers say there has been good demand this year in the region

title: Planting of nendran banana picks up pace in Tiruchi district
content: Farmers get good price if the produce hits the market in time; nendran banana is crop is cultivated in areas along the banks of the Cauvery because of dependable source of groundwater

title: B. Shankaranand was a proud son of Belagavi: Prabhakar Kore
content: Former minister B. Shankaranand was a proud son of Belagavi district who brought fame to Belagavi by taking it to the national level, former Rajyasabha member and Chairman of KLE Society Prabhakar Kore has said.

title: Draft regulations on renewable energy propose peer-to-peer energy trading
content: Individual power producers or groups can directly buy and sell electricity using an online platform, which should be run by an authorised service provider or the distribution licencee by meeting the technical standards and safety requirements.

title: Gas leak from ONGC pipeline near Kuthalam in Mayiladuthurai district triggers protest
content: ONGC technicians identify the source of leak and rectified the issue; people of the villages blocked the Mayiladuthurai–Kumbakonam State Highway in protest against the gas leak

title: Welfare calendar will soon be released, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: It will have complete schedule of implementation of schemes and promises, he says; the Chief Minister urges women to adopt the two-children policy

title: Seven killed as landslide-hit vehicle plunges into gorge in Arunachal Pradesh
content: Victims from two families; officials urge caution as monsoon-triggered landslides claim more lives across the State
